required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: Laparoscopy by its mini-invasive character has revolutionized abdominal and colorectal surgery but certain limitations remains (post-operative pain due to pneumoperitoneum, pneumoperitoneum stability, visibility during bleeding, smoke evacuation). The medical device for continuous pressure insufflation during laparoscopic procedures Airseal® would allow the maintenance of pneumoperitoneum at a lower pressure. The stable low pressure (7mmHg) is described in the literature for 15 years as the best way to reduce scapular pain, but until the marketing of Airseal, working at 7mmHg was not possible because the space of work was not stable. Moreover, this device makes it possible to obtain a better vision because of the evacuation of the fumes potentially leading to a reduction in the operating time.

detailed_description.textblock:
This research focuses on a medical device that allows the surgeon to perform the surgical procedure at a lower pressure than usual.
The main objective of this study is to compare the duration of hospitalization of patients with laparoscopic colectomy at low pressure (5-7 mmHg) versus standard pressure (12-15 mmHg) It is a prospective randomized monocentric double blind study

study_design_info.masking_description: The study will be carried out: Blind patient: The patient will not know the group he belongs to, in order to minimize the bias related to the self-evaluation of postoperative pain Blind for the outpatient evaluator: the surgeon will blindly evaluate the primary endpoint: patient's discharge criteria. This "evaluator" surgeon will be different from the "operator" surgeon The blind will minimize the measurement bias.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From surgery to the end of the hospitalization (max 30 days)
primary_outcome.description: To determine the length of hospitalization

secondary_outcome.measure: Appreciation of visual quality by surgeon
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the rate of visual quality during surgery: poor, medium or good quality

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of the use of microlaparoscopic instruments
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the rate of use of the microsurgery microlaparoscopic instruments (3mm)
Conversion to laparoscopy with standard pressure or conversion to laparotomy
To examine the variation of blood pressure during surgery (at the beginning, middle and at the end)
To examine the variation of cardiac frequency during surgery (at the beginning, middle and at the end)
To examine the volume replacement during surgery (at the beginning, middle and at the end)
To examine the variation of drinving pressure during surgery (at the beginning, middle and at the end)
To examine the variation of SA02 (%) during surgery (at the beginning, middle and at the end)

secondary_outcome.measure: Partial pressure of mean expired of carbon dioxide (mmHg)
secondary_outcome.description: To examine the variation PECO2 (mmHg) during surgery (at the beginning, middle and at the end)
To analyse the cumulative Clavien-Dindo at 30 days

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 hours, 4 hours, 8 hours and 24 hours after the surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Pain was evaluated with the Numeric Rating Scale (NRS, from 0 (no pain) to 10 (hurts worst)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: An average of 5 days after the surgery
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the rate of analgesics administrated (from step1 to step3)

secondary_outcome.measure: Time before the passage of first stool (days)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: An average of 5 days after the surgery
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the delay of the laxation and gas response

secondary_outcome.measure: Time before the passage of first gas (days)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: An average of 5 days after the surgery
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the delay of the gas response

secondary_outcome.measure: Time before mobilization (Days before 1st time sitting and standing)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: An average of 5 days after the surgery
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the delay before mobilization
Number of lymph nodes examed during a cancer surgery

arm_group.description: Laparoscopic colectomy surgery with low pressure (5-7mmHg)
Laparoscopic colectomy surgery with standard pressure (12-15mmHg)

intervention.description: Medical device set to the mode Airseal®, pressure adjustment between 5 and 7 mmHg
Medical device set to the mode "Standard Insufflation", pressure adjustment between 12 and 15 mmHg

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age ≥ 18
- Colonic resection (right or left) performed for benign or malignant pathology
- Laparoscopic procedure
- Informed consent signed
- Social Insurance
Exclusion Criteria:
- Laparotomy procedure
- Associated resection (except appendectomy or liver biopsy
- Emergency procedure
- Pelvic sepsis
- Pregnant or breast-feeding woman.
- Persons deprived of liberty or under guardianship
- Impossibility for compliance to follow-up
